From: Samar El Mallou
Sent: Tuesday, May 13, 2025 2:23 PM
To: Hagop Ghazarian
Cc: Adina Tomescu; Dana Mahdi
Subject: Loreal DA - Insurance clause 


Dear Hagob,

 

We have received an amended distribution agreement from Loreal and they have included a term regarding insurance. Please check below the clause and let me know if it is acceptable for Traveller.

 

ARTICLE 8 - INSURANCE

 

The Distributor shall take out at its expenses all necessary insurance policies to cover the risks resulting from the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, including any risks which may result from bad storage, handling or delivering conditions falling under its own distributor's or sub-suppliers’ liability.

 

Thanks,

ID: CG71TAG_04
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Samar El Mallou <Samar.Elmallou@chalhoub.com>
CC: Adina Tomescu <Adina.Tomescu@chalhoub.com>; Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-05-22 13:15
Subject: Re: Loreal DA - Insurance clause
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Samar,

No issue with the insurance clause.

We can insure the L'Oreal products for damages arising from imports, storage and handling. 

But more or less there will be an associated cost of 0.5% based on the cost value of the items brought in from L'Oreal.

Below is the broad cost breakdown:

~0.1% of cost for marine insurance
~0.1% of cost extra for local transit
~0.3% of cost extra for storage and handling and general liability cover

Also, insurance policies rarely cover 100% of the losses as there is almost always a policy excess that is borne by the insured which is something to take into consideration as well for costing purposes.

However, from a technical standpoint, it can be insured.

Best Regards,
Hagop

Also, insurance policies rarely cover 100% of the losses as there is almost always a policy excess that is borne by the insured which is something to take into consideration as well for costing purposes.

Best Regards,
Hagop

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 22, 2025 1:15:25 PM
To: Samar El Mallou <Samar.Elmallou@chalhoub.com>

Subject: Re: Loreal DA - Insurance clause 
 
Dear Samar,

No issue with the insurance clause.

We can insure the L'Oreal products for damages arising from imports, storage and handling.

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 22, 2025 1:15:25 PM
To: Samar El Mallou <Samar.Elmallou@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Adina Tomescu <Adina.Tomescu@chalhoub.com>; Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Loreal DA - Insurance clause 
 
Dear Samar,

No issue with the insurance clause.

We can insure the L'Oreal products for damages arising from imports, storage and handling. 

But more or less there will be an associated cost of 0.5% based on the cost value of the items brought in from L'Oreal.

Below is the broad cost breakdown:

~0.1% of cost for marine insurance
~0.1% of cost extra for local transit
~0.3% of cost extra for storage and handling and general liability cover

Also, insurance policies rarely cover 100% of the losses as there is almost always a policy excess that is borne by the insured which is something to take into consideration as well for costing purposes.

However, from a technical standpoint, it can be insured.

Best Regards,
Hagop
